entry.title: Export users from SAC tenant
entry.content:
Hi everybody,

would like to know if there is a way to export users from IAS and identify which ones are synced in SAC.

There is already a feature to export users but the fields inside the report are not relevant or identifiers of SAC tenant and there is no KBA explaining or denying this is possible.

Has someone manage to do it?

Thanks!

entry.title: SAC OAuth Client cannot read all files in filerespository
entry.content:
Dear Community,

I'm using the filerepository API (/api/v1/filerepository/Resources) to retrieve information about our content in SAC. During development I found out, that the OAuth Client cannot read files where "All users" don't have view access. I would have assumed that an OAuth Client for API usage would have access to all files?

When using the /api/v1/Resources API this OAuth client can even read stories from private folders, so the user has definitely enhanced privileges. However, the Resources API only reads stories, but we also want to retrieve resource from resourceType=ANALYSIS_WORKBOOK.

How can we give the OAuth Client access to all files (or add it to our team for administrators, so it can find all files)?

Best regards,
Harald

entry.title: SAC - Linking multiple models
entry.content:
Can you please let me know how can we implement a story from 4 BW Queries. 

I think using Link Dimensions option we can create 4 models and use them. but after linking how can we get all measures and dimensions from all models. Please provide the suggestion. Thanks

entry.title: week over week report in SAP analytics cloud
entry.content:
Hi,

I want to develop a story in SAC that displays measures week over week.

                                                                                              prev week             current week               WOW        

measure 1                                                                           1000                          1500                           50%

measure 2                                                                            800                          1000                             25%

 

There seems to be nothing inbuilt in SAC story to display week over week aggregates. Please let me know a week over week report can be developed in SAC.

entry.title: How to automate "exclude member" in tables
entry.content:
Dear All, I'm looking for a solution related to SAC table in stories.

We have some technical members in rows that are needed for calculations, but we don't want them to be visible in the table. I use "Exclude Member" option, but every time there's an update in the table, for example new dimension, the technical members occur again and I need to manually exclude them again.

Is there any option to use scrypting to exclude them on.click?

Excluding those items with filters works only with flat presentation, but we have hierarchies used in the tables.

Any advise will be appreciated. Thank you.

entry.title: Enable Now Data Integration into SAP Analytics Cloud
entry.content:
Greetings Community!

Currently, I manually transfer content data from SAP Enable Now, cloud edition  (SEN) to SAP Analytics Cloud  (SAC) each month using Excel, for review purposes. While SEN documentation indicates that data can be integrated into Microsoft Power BI, I have not found information regarding integration with SAC

Is there a way to establish a direct connection between SEN and SAC to ensure continuous and accurate data synchronization, eliminating the need for manual uploads? Thanks for any insight!

Best,

Andrew

entry.title: SAC Advanced Formula Calculate with first of each month
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

For my planning scenario, I have two data models with different levels of date granularity.

1. Calculate product costs (date granularity: monthly).
2. Calculate profitability (date granularity: day).

When copying the calculated product costs from the first data model, I select the option to write the prices to the first element of each period. For example, the price from 25 September is copied to 1 September 2025.

However, I am now facing a problem when calculating the revenue. The quantities are planned at a daily level. Therefore, revenue is only calculated correctly on the first day of the month, as this is where the price was copied to.

I can think of two ways to solve this problem:

1. Copy the price from the 1^(st) of the month to each day in the current month.
2. Calculate the revenue by referencing the price on the 1st of each month.

I tried to create a data action for the second option using the FIRST() function. Unfortunately, this function returns the first day of the year, not of each month.

CONFIG.HIERARCHY.INCLUDE_MEMBERS_NOT_IN_HIERARCHY = [d/Funktionsbereich] , [d/Sachkonto], [d/Kostenart], [d/Kunde],[d/CCW_Material], [d/Vertriebsweg], [d/Buchungskreis], [d/Profitcenter], [d/Sparte],[d/Verkaufsorganisation]

VARIABLEMEMBER #MENGE OF [d/Measures]

DATA([d/Measures] = #MENGE, [d/Funktionsbereich] = "#", [d/Sachkonto] = "#", [d/Profitcenter] = "#", [d/Sparte] = "#", [d/Kostenart] = "#") = RESULTLOOKUP([d/Measures] = "Menge_ST")
// Herstellkosten = Menge * Materialkosten
IF [d/Funktionsbereich] = BASEMEMBER([d/Funktionsbereich] , "Z0100") 
	OR [d/Funktionsbereich] =BASEMEMBER([d/Funktionsbereich] , "Z0120")
	OR [d/Funktionsbereich] =BASEMEMBER([d/Funktionsbereich] , "Z0110")
	OR [d/Funktionsbereich] =BASEMEMBER([d/Funktionsbereich] , "Z0300")
	OR [d/Funktionsbereich] =BASEMEMBER([d/Funktionsbereich] , "Z0301")
	OR [d/Funktionsbereich] =BASEMEMBER([d/Funktionsbereich] , "Z0140")
	OR [d/Funktionsbereich] =BASEMEMBER([d/Funktionsbereich] , "Z0130")
THEN
	FOREACH [d/Datum]
	DELETE([d/Measures] = "Umsatz")
	DATA([d/Measures] = "Umsatz", [d/Kostenart]= "#") = RESULTLOOKUP([d/Measures] = #MENGE, [d/Funktionsbereich] = "#", [d/Sachkonto] = "#", [d/Kostenart] = "#")
	* RESULTLOOKUP([d/Measures] = "Preis", [d/Kunde] = "#", [d/Datum] = FIRST([d/Datum].[p/CALMONTH]), [d/Profitcenter] = "#", [d/Sparte] = "#",[d/Sachkonto] = "#")*-1
	ENDFOR
ENDIF

Does anyone have a solution for this?
I am grateful for any assistance. Thank you in advance.

Could anyone please suggest a solution if you have faced this issue before?
Thank you in advance for your support.

entry.title: Geographical dimensions and hierarchies in new SAC datamodels
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

I am simply looking to understand them when importing a local Excel file for now.

My main interrogation is about the geographical dimensions. With the classic model, you simply had to click the icon 'Geo enrichment', then choose Coordinates or Area Name, then select the corresponding columns, and you basically had your geographical dimension.

In the new model, the only way I found to do this is by adding the properties 'Latitude' and 'Longitude', to the dimension, which automatically creates a dimension table, and transforms it into a valid geographical dimension.

The first question : Is that the only way to do it in the new type of model ?

So now I have my cities geo enriched with the coordinates, but I would like to add a hierarchy on top of that, to maybe be able to dig in a geo map. (Go from continent, to country, to city for instance)

I can't figure out how to do this right now, do I have to create the hierarchy before ? But then I can't create the dimension table necessary for the coordinates.

My second question would be : Is it possible to have a geographical dimension with a level-hierarchy in the new models ?

I am just trying to make sure I did not miss some new functionnality.

Have a great day !

If I select April it showing April month value. If I select May Month. it showing April and May cumulative value.

Off course, I have other Date filter for Year in story.

 

Regards,

Vasu

entry.title: SAC - table title mirrored to the next cell
entry.content:
Hi,

I have this table that i created with a title.

For some reason, when i copy the text to the table title, this text is mirrored to the next line like this:

If i just type the title, this doesn't happen.

The problem is that once i have this text mirrored inside the cell below, i cannot remove it anymore.

Is there a way to remove it directly without creating a new table from scratch?

Appreciate your help in advance.

entry.title: SAC Key User rights with other View reporting rights
entry.content:
Hi,

We have enabled Key User rights in SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC) for selected users, allowing them to create their own stories within designated folders (e.g., Folder A and Folder B in our example).

Our SAC environment primarily uses live data models, which means roles based on import models are not applicable.

In our current setup:

  • The user has view access to Report A (based on Model A).
  • The same user has Key User rights for Report B (based on Model B), enabling them to create additional stories based on Model B within Folder B.

However, since the user also has Key User rights and view access to Model A, we’ve observed that they are able to create stories based on Model A within Folder B—which is not intended.

We would like to know if there is a way to restrict story creation in Folder B to only those based on Model B, even though the user has access to other models.

Thank you!

entry.title: Widget is visible in ppt export even when made invisible
entry.content:
Hello SAC experts,

I would like to export a SAC story into PPT in a certain layout, which includes only widget required for the export. This means I would like to remove certain widgets before exporting to PPT.

I have created a button, which makes unwanted widgets invisible:  xxx.setVisible(false). When I export the story in PPT format, it exports all widgets independent on value of this parameter (all widgets are visible). The same behavior is when using the standard PPF export or "Export To PPTX". Unfortunately "Export To PPTX" does not offer the option to chose the widgets as in ExportToPDF. Can you please advice, how to adapt a story into a print version without creating a separate story with the print specific layout?

Thank you.

entry.title: NDC Converter 2.0: Automating Your Journey from BusinessObjects to Cloud Analytics
entry.content:
SAP Business Data Cloud (BDC) provides a unified platform for data ingestion, semantic modeling, governance and analytics. For teams migrating from SAP BusinessObjects (BO), BDC enables:

  • A governed semantic layer in SAP Datasphere that faithfully reproduces and extends your existing BO universes with standardized naming conventions, hierarchies and calculated measures.
  • Cloud-native analytics in SAC for reporting, planning and predictive scenarios, powered by either live data connections or scheduled replication jobs.
  • A clear modernization path for SAP BW/4HANA artifacts and non-SAP sources, preserving embedded business logic while consolidating disparate models.

By porting Web Intelligence (WebI) content into BDC, you can retire legacy BO infrastructure and establish a sustainable foundation built on remote or replicated tables, graphical and SQL views and published semantic models that are fully consumable in SAC.

 

In this follow-up to our NDC Converter introduction, we’ll showcase its newest capabilities and zoom in on how REST APIs, RPA and the SAP BDC stack work together to fully automate your migration workflow and eliminate uncertainty that is often associated with these sorts of projects.

Analysis & clean-up

Migration kicks off with a thorough source analysis powered by our enhanced scanning engine. After installing a lightweight Windows executable in your environment, NDC Converter uses the BusinessObjects REST API to perform a repository-wide scan - cataloging WebI documents, variables, filters and data sources. Parallel processing enables multiple report structures to be inventoried simultaneously, cutting traditional analysis times from days to hours.

If BO access is restricted, you can export a full content catalog instead and NDC Converter will generate a self-service metadata report for rapid sizing and compliance checks. These automated scans deliver hard metrics on:

  • Volume: total reports, pages, charts and objects
  • Complexity: calculations, variables, dimensions and interactive features
  • Usage: inactive or overlapping content

Armed with this detailed data, we can scope migration efforts accurately within days rather than weeks, giving prospects immediate insight into their BI landscape without manual, time-consuming analysis.

Automated report migration

Once WebI queries are identified, the next step is to align them with target system (usually SAP Datasphere but other options available too – for reference see previous blog post). Steps here include:

  • Linking each WebI query to its target system
  • Generating the necessary migration definitions
  • Automatically provisioning and deploying the corresponding tables

If you’re working with many tables, the “mass deploy” feature lets you push them live in bulk—no tedious one-by-one clicks.

After tables are deployed, we configure on-demand or scheduled data replication to maintain synchronization between target and source systems, followed by creating graphical and SQL-based views to implement calculation logic. The final step is to publish these views to SAP Analytics Cloud where up-to-date data can be accessed.

The data source layer migration involves analyzing the BO repository, migrating universe metadata and/or transitioning live models based on BEx queries. Upon completion of the initial data migration, a comprehensive semantic model is introduced that mirrors your original WebI structures including dimensions, measures, hierarchies and data. This transformation provides a cloud-ready foundation for all SAP Analytics Cloud initiatives.

NDC Converter 2.0

With your semantic model live, we proceed with WebI reports migration into SAP Analytics Cloud as interactive stories with new high functional coverage. NDC Converter retrieves each report’s layout, structures, tables, charts, filters and visual elements via the BusinessObjects REST API. A blueprint compatible with RPA processing is produced, covering:

  • Layout & structure: multi‑page documents, IDs, descriptions, pages/tabs.
  • Tables & crosstabs: calculated and restricted measures, variables and common WebI calculations.
  • Charts: Bar/Column, Line, Numeric Point, Pie, Donut, Heat Map, Tree Map, Bubble, Scatterplot.
  • Formatting & UX: predefined template stories, titles, text, headers/footers, icons.
  • Filters & interactivity: input controls, query filters, single object filters, drill, hyperlinks.

The RPA bot, delivered as a Chrome extension, reads this blueprint and automates the reconstruction of each report in SAC Story 2.0, preserving original tables, crosstabs, charts, parameters and filters. The resulting SAC Stories mirror your WebI reports while leveraging cloud-native data models.

What stays manual (and why)

NDC Converter automates routine migration tasks, allowing your team to focus on strategic design and governance – here are cases where automation does not bring added value:

  • Data model (business semantics) design: turning technical structures into robust semantic layer requires continuous alignment on reporting vision.
  • Edge cases & redesign: in situations where 1:1 replication isn’t optimal, we propose a workaround solution to comply with business and technical needs.
  • Environment setup: Migrating users, roles and platform configurations using a mix of guided best practices and selective automation.

Collaborate end-end delivery

NDC Converter is an ideal tool for complex migration scenarios, automating the transfer of every structural element—from metadata and queries to filters and visual object definitions. Once the converter has recreated the report skeletons in SAC, your BI team can take over the final steps: refining layouts, adjusting chart properties and validating calculation logic. This collaborative workflow ensures that the most time-consuming technical migrations are handled automatically, while you retain full control over presentation, branding and business requirements.

entry.title: SAP Analytics Cloud - Lock Data Entry for Read-User
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

The standard behavior of Data Access Control is that read-only users are still able to enter data, but they are not able to publish it.

This can be confusing. Is there a way to completely lock the data for users who only have read access, while still allowing users with write access to enter data in the same table?

Kind regards,

Ismail

entry.title: How to show Current vs Previous Month-Year values with two independent filters in SAC?
entry.content:
I have a requirement in SAP Analytics Cloud where a table needs to show Current Month and Previous Month values side by side.

Currently, I use a single month_year filter. For example, if the user selects June 2025, the table displays:

  • Current Month = June 2025

  • Previous Month = May 2025

However, the client wants two separate filters:

  • One filter for Current Month-Year (e.g., June 2025)

  • Another filter for Previous Month-Year (e.g., May 2024)

This way, the user can choose any two periods independently (even across different years), and the table should display:

  • Current Value: June 2025

  • Previous Value: May 2024

  • Difference: June 2025 – May 2024

Data Source: SAP ECC 

Is it possible to design such functionality in SAC stories (e.g., via input controls, variables, or restricted measures)? If yes, what would be the best approach?

entry.title: moving/rolling sum for specific amount of dates in SAC
entry.content:
Hello community,

I have a requirement to calculate a rolling sum over 7 days in this case. And I want to visualize this value over time in a chart.

Here is an example of how the calculation should look like:

Datesales7 day sum
01.09.2025125125
02.09.2025100225
03.09.202575300
04.09.2025250550
05.09.2025100650
06.09.20253501000
07.09.20252751275
08.09.20251501300
09.09.20251001300
10.09.20251101335

The calculation function for running total does not really work here, because of the missing option to restrict the time period to 7 days. I have also tried this formula: ResultLookup([sales] ;[date]= PREVIOUS(90; "DAY";[date]))  but unfortunately the system does not allow the function PREVIOUS to be used in this context. 

I am using an analytical model from SAP Datasphere as source.

Does anybody know a solution to this problem?

entry.title: SAP Analytics Cloud - Lock Year Column in SAC Excel AddIn
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

We would like to lock the Year column so that data entry is only possible for Months. We solved this by using styling rules.

Unfortunately, styling rules cannot be used in the SAC Excel Add-In. Does anyone have an idea on how to achieve this requirement?

Kind regards,
Ismail
